ThingDef.label: gomphotaria
ThingDef.description:
Long extinct giant mammals, brought back to life as a part of the Megafauna Project.

Gomphotaria is equipped with not two, but four huge tusks that it uses to hammer and pierce its prey with.
Their seal-like bodies allow them to move very swiftly underwater but their huge mass as well as a lack of legs renders them somewhat sluggish on land.

ThingDef.label: diprotodon
ThingDef.description:
Long extinct giant mammals, brought back to life as a part of the Megafauna Project.

The largest known marsupial to have ever lived. As huge as a rhinoceros, it resembles a gigantic wombat.
Diprotodon's a relatively peaceful creature, however its huge pair of forward-facing teeth as well as its strong claws can prove quite dangerous in a combat situation.

ThingDef.label: Short-faced bear
ThingDef.description: Long extinct giant mammals, brought back to life as a part of the Megafauna Project.\n\nOne of the largest, if not the largest bear in history. What stands out the most about its appearance is the disproportionately short snout compared to other bears and the extraordinarily long legs it possesses. The latter makes it so hardly any prey can effectively outrun it.

ThingDef.label: dinocrocuta
ThingDef.description:
Long extinct giant mammals, brought back to life as a part of the Megafauna Project.

Gigantic hyena-like predators. Their exceptionally strong jaws easily crush bones.
Extremely aggresive, it's known to surprisingly often prey on animals larger than itself.

ThingDef.label: sivatherium
ThingDef.description: Long extinct giant mammals, brought back to life as a part of the Megafauna Project.\n\nThe biggest ruminant in history. Unlike its modern equivalents, giraffes and okapis, sivatherium possesses two pairs of ossicones, one that is wide and resembles antlers, and the other being more horn-like, placed above its eyes.

ThingDef.label: andrewsarchus
ThingDef.description:
Long extinct giant mammals, brought back to life as a part of the Megafauna Project.

This mysterious carnivore was the biggest predatory mammal of its time.
Often described as a "bear-dog", it was apparently related to entelodonts, hippopotamuses, and whales.

ThingDef.label: dinornis
ThingDef.description: Long extinct giant birds, brought back to life as a part of the Megafauna Project.\n\nThe tallest birds to ever exist. They belong to the moa family and are characterised by quite dramatic sexual dimorphism, with the females being significantly larger than the males

ThingDef.label: macrauchenia
ThingDef.description:
Long extinct giant mammals, brought back to life as a part of the Megafauna Project.

Despite it possessing a trunk, macrauchenia's nostrils are actually located on the top of its head.
It's extraordinarily agile and thanks to its ability of rapidly changing directions while running at high speed, it can escape most predators fairly easily.

ThingDef.label: quinkana
ThingDef.description:
Long extinct giant reptiles, brought back to life as a part of the Megafauna Project.

This terrestrial crocodile possesses long legs, which render it much better of a runner than its modern equivalents.
Quinkana's teeth are shaped like knives, which makes them perfect for practically cutting away parts of its prey.
